title: Police officer kills woman inside her Texas home after welfare call
text:
CLOSE

Texas State Promo (Photo: Shane Music)

FORT WORTH, Texas – Authorities in Texas say a black woman was fatally shot by a white officer inside her Fort Worth home after police were called to the residence for a welfare check.

The shooting occurred early Saturday after a neighbor called police to say the front door to the home was open, according to The Fort Worth Star-Telegram.

In body camera video released by police, two officers search the house from the outside with flashlights before one shouts, “Put your hands up, show me your hands.” One shot is fired through a window.

The woman was pronounced dead at the scene. The Tarrant County Medical Examiner’s Office identified her as 28-year-old Atatiana Jefferson.

The officer does not identify himself as police in the video. In a statement, police say he has been placed on administrative leave.

Read or Share this story: https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2019/10/12/fort-worth-police-officer-kills-woman-inside-home/3964079002/
description: A black woman was fatally shot by a white officer inside her Fort Worth home after police were called to the residence for a welfare check.
